reviewText:
EDIT: As of March 21st, all issues with the game have been cleared up, and I will give a full review of the game. The art assets have been changed over so they are not anyone elses, and launching issues with the game have been resolved. With all this said, I now feel I can give a full (and positive) review of the game, which I actually enjoy.

~~~

Generic Space Shooter is pretty much like the name says, but this isn't necessarily a bad thing. It's a single screen shooter much like in the vein of Geometry Wars, with its own twists being the type of upgrades it has, the unlockable ships, and the unique (from what I've seen) control scheme. The game controls entirely with the mouse, with left click being shoot, and right click being the ship's thrusters. This can create a sort of frantic back and forth with the mouse, especially when fighting bosses that get progressively faster and faster the weaker they get, so I'm not entirely sure if I like it more vs a traditional WASD move, mouse aim to shoot. It definitely makes kiting a very different experience.

Powerups are varied, and I have a mixed feeling on how a few of them work.
Fast shots (orange) let you shoot your standard shot very rapidly. One of the best upgrades imo, since in shooters spamming the screen with your bullets as much aspossible is how you not-die".
Quick shots (yellow) shoot your normal rate
date: but the projectile speed is much faster. This is useful for long range sniping
recommended: but otherwise seemed a fairly minor upgrade to me especially compared to some others.\nWavey (sic) shots (teal) make your shoots move wild and erratically
hoursPlayed: making aiming impossible and forcing you to just fire a cloud of shots. This can be useful
voteText: it will shoot down enemy projectiles
helpfulPercent: but I never really felt happy to get a Wavey Shot over say a shield or a Fast Shot.\nPiercing Shots (red) lower your rate of fire a bit
votesHelpful: but make your shots pierce your enemies. This is very useful on bigger enemies
votesTotal: since the piercing shot seems to damage on a per frame basis
votesFunny: so one shot will pretty much rip big enemies to pieces.\nShield (blue) Gives you a shield that stops shots
commentsCount: and also lets you ram into enemies to destroy them. Very useful since you can grab it and power into a big crowd. Doesn't seem to damage bosses? I'm not sure
column16: I couldn't tell.\nBullet Trail (purple) makes you fire extremely rapidly
column17: but your shots stay in place unless an enemy gets very close to them
column18: then it home in and hits them. This lets you leave a trail or trail or minefield of shots behind you
column19: and is extremely useful for the bosses that like you chase you. As a bonus
column21: every shot fires and gains momentum at the same time
column22: allowing you to effectively shotgun people. Also very useful for bosses: you can lay a hyperdense field of shots
column23: and watch them all crash into the boss simultaneously for huge damage. Fun powerup.\n\nAmmo (green) doesn't give you a boost
column24: but just adds ammunition to your basic weapon. I think this is an odd choice in the genre
column25: and I feel like adding an ammo count to your basic weapon in a space shooter doesn't actually add anything. I would like it if Ammo was changed into say
column29: and the concept of ammo just removed from the game. You don't get point bonuses for precision or not missing
column30: so it's just an artificial limitation. Powerup shots don't consume ammo
column31: so picking up ammo doesn't feel fun or exciting
column32: it feels like a wasted powerup. Now
column34: and picking up Ammo refilled your ammo for that powerup
column36: but that would be more work
column37: being able to swap between ammo types
column39: and it's understandable if that's work the dev doesn't want to do - the current system is fine
column40: I just think it'd be better without ammo for the default shot.\n\nThe game works on a timed level system
column41: and every so often the game levels up
column42: making all enemies worth more points
column43: and making new and more enemy types appear. Every so often
column45: r which ar ehuge clusters of normal ships. Bosses generally follow a pattern of getting faster and shooting more often the lower they get on life
column46: to the point where it can be difficult to continue to move and still get shots in without having Fast Shots
column47: Shields or Bullet Trails. The downside of this timed system is the very early game can come off as very slow - it often takes me 2 levels before I get enemies that actually shoot back at me and don't just slowly fly towards me and ie in one shot. Once the game gets rolling though
column48: it doesn't slow down.\n\nAs you play the game
column50: most of which focus on and upgrade one particular powerup type
column53: etc. I don't have all the ships unlocked yet
column54: so I don't know what all abilities exist yet
column55: but it's cool that you can focus on a particular powerup you enjoy the most. I'm curious as to what the Ammo powerrup ships to
column56: since I don't have those ships yet.\n\nThe game is fun
column57: and I've definitely paid more for lunch than I paid for this game
column58: so you can't beat that. I would happily recommend it to anyone looking for a quick fix or a game to be able to play at lunch
column60: or any sort of short burst playing."

reviewText: I seriously cannot believe how awesome this game is. I literally have trouble putting it down. Every time I die and see my end score I go AAAHHH I have to try that one more time! The powerups are a lot of fun and the ability to unlock ships that aren't just different skins slapped on the same ship is great! The simple controls allow you to consentrate on defeating the enemies and the fact that your gun is not perpetually stuck in the on position
date: as it is with most space shooters
recommended: makes the game more challenging. An online leaderboard would make this game better
hoursPlayed: but other than that this is a great game for a great price!"

reviewText: A fun little game, though a bit too hard perhaps, at least for me, but well worth the price.

reviewText: Controls are a mess. You can use wasd" to move while unable to fire
date: figures if controller is connected you must use it. But then why the hell "wasd" is active? Ok
recommended: i've disconnected controller and "wasd" became inactive. What? It's only possible to use mouse. The difference in controls is huge. While using a controller you can dodge and shoot while mouse doesn't allow you that freedom of control. And even when "wasd" was active movement felt clunky and completely unusable.\n\nAs title itself suggests
hoursPlayed: avoid. Even though it has some twist with bullets

reviewText: This is a very fun game! There is a lot more to it that it seems at first sight. It also has very good potential for expansion. I definitely recommend this game to anyone who is bored and looking for some game where you shoot some things while dodging bullets and other things flying at you. Also the soundtrack is pretty good too :P
voteText: 13 of 29 people (45%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: Played this for a short while. Got to say it is fun and challenging. The contols are about as easy as it gets for a game like this.  You fly and shoot all from the mouse. This makes it diffrent then others that let you fly around with one control type,  aim and fire with another. If you like 2D space shooters, give this one a try.

Anything but "generic" due to responsive
date: fluid and brilliantly simple mouse controls.\n\n30 ships to unlock by beating certain tasks while playing the game
recommended: each with its own perks and advantages and procedural game elements mean that no two games will ever be the same.  This all equals a super high replay value.\n\nGames play quick
hoursPlayed: meaning that this is a perfect game to play when you don't have much time to sink in and want to have a "blast" fast.\n\nWatch my quick video above to see exactly why I not only scored this game super high at an impressive 93%
voteText:
but also why I give it my rare "MUST BUY!" recommendation!

** Notes on HOW TO FIX A "MISSING EXECUTABLE" Error When You Launch The Game **
.... These steps are only for Windows
helpfulPercent: I don't have a Linux or a Mac
votesHelpful: sorry ....\n\nIf you get this error when you buy and install the game
votesTotal: please do the following to fix it..\n\n1) Navigate to your C Drive... (Double click My Computer
votesFunny:
Double Click C Drive)

2) Double Click {Program Files (x86)} folder

3) Double Click {Steam} folder

4) Double Click {steamapps} folder

5) Double Click {common} folder

6) Double Click {Generic Space Shooter} folder

7) Double Click {Windows} folder

8) Click on {The GSS_Data} folder to highlight it
commentsCount: then hold CTRL down on your keyboard and also highlight the GSS file\n\n9) With both of these highlighted
column16:
Right click your mouse and select COPY (Or hit CTRL-C)

10) Hit the blue back arrow at the top-left of your window to navigate back to the Generic Space Shooter folder and move your cursor to a blank spot in the window below the windows folder

11) Right click your mouse and choose PASTE to copy the folder and the GSS file here (or press CTRL-V)

..Now your game should launch from the desktop shortcut or from Steam with no problems!  :-)  Have fun!"

reviewText: Generic Space Shooter can only be described a classic arcade shooter, its clearly influenced by Meteor and  other games of that era.  All I need now is trackball, a pint of mild and upright cabinet to complete the picture.\n\nPlus, top marks to the developer for fixing the initial Linux issues.

Fun and quick game, exactly as the name suggest but it has enough if things that make it stand out, plenty of unlocks and plenty of ways to challenge you. The control is better suited for controllers than keyboards, In fact, I can't imagine trying to play this game without a controller.
